{"step_by_step_thinking": "Palpable purpura is a condition where small blood vessels leak blood under the skin, causing purpura (purple-colored spots) that can be felt on the skin. H.S. Purpura, also known as Henoch-Schönlein purpura, is a type of vasculitis that often presents with palpable purpura. Mixed cryoglobulinemia is a type of vasculitis that can also present with palpable purpura. Drug-induced vasculitis is another condition that can cause palpable purpura. However, Giant cell arteritis, while it is a type of vasculitis, typically affects larger vessels and does not usually present with palpable purpura.", "answer_choice": "C. Giant cell arteritis"}
